awd_titl_txt: RAPID: Connecting Early Stage Capital to the Deep Tech Innovation Ecosystem
awd_abstract_narration:
The technologies under development in the deep tech space have the potential to radically transform and disrupt a wide variety of industries. The outcome of this project would be to promote discovery and understanding of technologies related to the defined ten technology focus areas. These advancements, with the assistance of angel investor capital, will lead to new products and services in fields as varied as artificial intelligence, astronomy, biotechnology, climate modeling, cybersecurity, drug discovery and development, energy storage and conversion, genomics, materials science, quantum computing, space exploration, and drug development, etc.

This project is designed to better educate the angel investor community on the benefits of deep tech investments with the intention of increasing the amount of private capital available for deployment in the deep tech sector. To achieve this, the following three project activities will be undertaken: (1) Data Collection: Engage in a data collection effort to better understand how angel investors are currently investing in Deep Tech. (2) Investor Education: Develop a series of educational programs to expose angel investors to the technology and commercialization potential of Deep Tech. (3) Investor Activation: Introduce angel investors to Deep Tech start-ups through regional convenings, the ACA annual Summit, and the ACA's national syndication effort.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: EXP PROG TO STIM COMP RES

por.por_cntn:
RAPID: Connecting Early Stage Capital to the Deep Tech Innovation Ecosystem

Project Overview

This project was designed to better educate the angel investor community on the benefits of Deep Tech investments with the intention of increasing the amount of private capital available for deployment in the Deep Tech sector. To achieve this objective, the following project goals were fulfilled.

Goal #1: Data Collection: The project's principal investigator organized a data collection effort to better understand how angel investors are currently investing in Deep Tech. Both qualitative and quantitative datasets were collected. The culmination of this data has been included in the Deep Tech toolkit, available for complimentary download here: 

https://angelcapitalassociation.growthzoneapp.com/ap/Form/Fill/rOekJf2P

Goal #2: Investor Education: One of the project outcomes was the development of a series of educational programs designed to expose angel investors to the technology and commercialization potential of Deep Tech. This webinar series delivered content related to the ten critical technology areas defined in the Chips and Science Act. Additional webinar content centered around sharing best practices of performing due diligence on Deep Tech start-ups.

Goal #3- Investor Activation: Angel investors were introducted to Deep Tech start-ups through regional convenings, the ACA annual Summit, and the ACA's national syndication effort.

This award also strived to fulfill the NSF criteria related to Intellectual Merit and Broader Impact.

Intellectual Merit

The technologies under development in the Deep Tech space have the potential to radically transform and disrupt a wide variety of industries. The outcome of this project was to promote discovery and understanding of these technologies. These innovations, with the assistance of angel investor capital, will hopefully lead to new products and services in fields as varied as artificial intelligence, astronomy, biotechnology, climate modeling, cybersecurity, drug discovery and development, energy storage and conversion, genomics, materials science, quantum computing, space exploration, and drug development, etc.

Broader Impacts

The commercialization of the Deep Tech innovations can impact society in a number of ways. These innovations are being created to address the critical issues of our time: expanding the human lifespan, creating renewable energy sources, improving public safety and disaster preparedness, minimizing waste generation, and providing access and opportunity for knowledge acquisition through virtual learning experiences. Exposing more angel investors to the investment opportunities available in the Deep Tech Sector will hopefully stimulate more private capital into these important innovations. Catalyzing this private investment will catalyze national and regional economic development initiatives.

 


Last Modified: 01/07/2025
Modified by: Margaret Bacheler

Image
  • This complimentary toolkit is available to anyone interested in learning more about Deep Tech Investing. The toolkit can be downloaded here: https://angelcapitalassociation.growthzoneapp.com/ap/Form/Fill/rOekJf2P
    Randi Daniels of 381 Design
    Copyrighted
    Margaret Bacheler
    ACA Deep Tech Tookit
